ground_truth: Harry's smile goes away as Chili smiles at her, and they appear hooked. Martin is leaning and then leans forward. Bo Catlett exchanges a look with the Bear and signals the waiter. Karen, Martin, and Chili walk out to the driveway, and Chili follows Martin over to the minivan, opening the door for him. In the meantime, Bo Catlett and Harry are laughing, with Harry very drunk as he finishes another drink. Harry looks at Bo, unable to believe what's happening to his life, thinks for a moment, shakes his head, and looks around the restaurant. Bo and the Bear exchange looks as Chili and Karen enter the restaurant. Chili checks out the bar, sees they aren't there, then looks up at the railing, keeping his eyes up there as he speaks. Another glance at the Bear, and they all look. Chili moves to the staircase, seeing the Bear in his Hawaiian shirt standing a few steps from the top, and slowly moves his gaze up through hibiscus until he's looking at the man's bearded face. Chili continues up the stairs to where Bo Catlett stands beside the table, unbuttons his coat, and gets within three steps of the guy before stopping, keeping his eyes fixed on the man's gut. Bo walks past Chili and goes down the stairs. Karen watches as Bo Catlett puts a hand in his coat pocket and steps right up to Chili; she looks at him. Even Karen is looking at him differently now as they slide into the booth with a now shocked, rapidly sobering Harry. Karen and Chili look at each other as Harry finishes his drink, and Harry looks at the two of them differently now. Chili looks at Karen, smiles, and shakes his head. Harry looks at him and then hangs up at the other end. Bones thinks about it a moment and tosses the book aside, while phone to his ear, Harry downs another drink and sits up as Bones bursts out of the john, grabs the phone, getting Bones's attention. Bones stares at the phone, sits there a moment, also staring at the phone, while Chili stands as Curtis opens Chili's wallet, looks at the driver's license, and Dunbar in the plaid shirt pulls the Lakers T-shirt out of the athletic bag, feels around inside. Chili watches Curtis pick up the note with the Newark Flight number and arrival time written on it, glances about to make sure no one's around, then pulls the key for the 'right' locker out from a crack in the pavement near the stairwell. Now there's a big guy in a plaid wool shirt next to him, the same guy seen when Bo Catlett was there, and another guy down the aisle talking on his hand radio.

Karen, Martin, and Chili leave for the driveway, and Chili opens the minivan door for Martin. Meanwhile, a drunk Harry and Bo laugh together. He glances at the Bear as Chili heads to the stairs, sees the Bear in a Hawaiian shirt, and slowly looks at his bearded face. Dunbar, in a plaid shirt, removes a Lakers T-shirt from a bag. Chili notes Curtis picking up a note with a Newark Flight number, checks his surroundings, then retrieves a key from a crack in the pavement. A big guy in a plaid wool shirt stands nearby, the same one seen with Bo earlier, while another man talks on a hand radio.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Harry's once radiant smile fades as Chili grins at her, and the two seem captivated, appearing deeply engrossed in each other's presence. Meanwhile, Martin is initially leaning casually but then shifts his posture to lean forward with intent. Bo Catlett shares a meaningful glance with the Bear before discretely signaling the waiter. Together, Karen, Martin, and Chili make their way out to the driveway; Chili dutifully follows Martin to the waiting minivan, courteously opening the door for him. Meanwhile, back inside, Bo Catlett and Harry find themselves laughing heartily, though Harry, clearly very drunk, finishes yet another drink. He looks over at Bo, his expression one of disbelief as he tries to fathom the state of his life. After pausing to ponder for a moment, he shakes his head in dismay and scans the restaurant. While this unfolds, Bo and the Bear exchange knowing looks just as Chili and Karen make their entrance into the establishment. Chili surveys the bar, noting their absence, then shifts his gaze upward toward the railing, maintaining his focus in that direction while he speaks. Casting another glance toward the Bear, they all turn their attention. Chili proceeds toward the staircase, noticing the Bear donning a Hawaiian shirt, and standing just a few steps from the top. His gaze travels slowly upward through vivid hibiscus patterns until he meets the man's bearded face. Chili continues his ascent up the steps until he reaches the spot where Bo Catlett stands beside the table. As Chili unbuttons his coat, he comes within three steps of the man before halting, choosing to keep his eyes locked on the man's midsection. Bo nonchalantly walks past Chili, descending the stairs. Observing this, Karen sees Bo Catlett put a hand in his coat pocket before stepping right up to Chili, and she regards him intently. Even Karen's perception of him seems to shift as they settle into the booth with Harry, who is now visibly shocked and rapidly sobering. Karen exchanges a significant look with Chili as Harry finishes his drink, now viewing the pair differently. Chili glances at Karen, offering a smile before shaking his head in mild disbelief. Harry turns his gaze toward him and then disengages from the conversation. Elsewhere, Bones takes a moment to contemplate before nonchalantly tossing the book aside. While still on the phone, Harry downs yet another drink, straightening up as Bones bursts out of the restroom, urgently grabbing the phone, which seizes Bones's attention. Bones fixes a stare on the phone, sits momentarily, also staring at the phone in a stupefied manner, while Chili stands by. Curtis opens Chili's wallet, inspects the driver's license, as Dunbar, clad in a plaid shirt, pulls the Lakers T-shirt from an athletic bag and fumbles around inside it. Chili observes as Curtis picks up the note bearing the Newark Flight number and its specific arrival time. He casts a cautious glance around to ensure no one's watching before retrieving the key for the 'right' locker from a subtle crack in the pavement near the stairwell. At this moment, a big guy in a plaid wool shirt stands beside him, the same individual seen with Bo Catlett earlier, while yet another person is down the aisle engaged in conversation on his hand radio.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Harry's once radiant and infectious smile diminishes as Chili grins at her with a knowing look, creating a moment where the two seem utterly captivated, their attention deeply engrossed in each other's presence as if the world around them has paused. Meanwhile, Martin, who initially stands with a casual lean, adjusts his posture and leans forward with a newfound intent and purpose. Bo Catlett, in a moment of silent communication, shares a meaningful glance with the Bear before discreetly and subtly signaling the waiting waiter. Together, Karen, Martin, and Chili make their way out to the expansive driveway; Chili, in a gesture of respect, dutifully follows Martin to the patiently waiting minivan, courteously opening the door for him with a gentlemanly nod. Meanwhile, back inside the bustling establishment, Bo Catlett and Harry find themselves erupting into hearty laughter, though Harry, now clearly inebriated beyond his normal state, finishes yet another drink. His expression shifts to one of disbelief as he looks over at Bo, trying to comprehend the chaotic state of his life. After a brief pause, spent pondering the situation, he shakes his head slowly in dismay, casting his gaze across the restaurant as if in search of answers.

As this unfolds, Bo and the Bear exchange knowing, conspiratorial looks just as Chili and Karen make their re-entrance into the lively establishment. Chili surveys the bar area, noting with a look of keen observation their absence, then shifts his gaze upward toward the railing, maintaining his focus in that elevated direction while he speaks with a calm demeanor. Casting yet another glance toward the Bear, they all turn their attention collectively. Chili proceeds with determined steps toward the staircase, taking note of the Bear who is donning a vibrant Hawaiian shirt, standing just a few steps from the top. His gaze travels slowly, tracing through the vivid hibiscus patterns until he meets the man's bearded face with a steady, unwavering look. Chili continues his deliberate ascent up the steps until he reaches the spot where Bo Catlett stands beside the table. As he unbuttons his coat, he comes within three steps of the man before stopping, choosing to keep his focused eyes locked intently on the man's midsection. Bo, with a casual air, nonchalantly walks past Chili, descending the stairs in a relaxed manner. Observing this, Karen sees Bo Catlett put a hand in his coat pocket before stepping right up to Chili, and she regards him with intense curiosity. Even Karen’s perception seems to shift subtly as they all settle into the booth with Harry, who is now visibly shocked and rapidly sobering up from his earlier state. Karen exchanges a significant, understanding look with Chili as Harry finishes his drink, now viewing the pair in a different light. Chili glances at Karen with a soft smile before shaking his head in mild disbelief. Harry turns his gaze toward him and then chooses to disengage from the conversation.

Elsewhere within the establishment, Bones takes a moment to contemplate thoughtfully before nonchalantly tossing the book aside with a careless flick of his wrist. While still engaged on the phone, Harry quickly downs yet another drink, straightening up just as Bones bursts out of the restroom, urgently grabbing the phone, which instantly seizes Bones's scattered attention. Bones fixes a steady stare on the phone, sits momentarily, also staring at the device in a stupefied manner, while Chili stands by, surveying the scene. Curtis, with a meticulous air, opens Chili's wallet, inspects the driver's license with scrutiny, while Dunbar, clad in a casual plaid shirt, pulls the Lakers T-shirt from an athletic bag and fumbles around inside it with a distracted air. Chili observes intently as Curtis picks up the note bearing the Newark Flight number along with its specific arrival time. He casts a cautious glance around, ensuring no one's watching his actions, before stealthily retrieving the key for the 'right' locker from a subtle crack in the pavement near the stairwell. At this precise moment, a big guy in a thick plaid wool shirt stands beside him, the same individual who was seen earlier with Bo Catlett, while yet another person is further down the aisle, engaged in an animated conversation on his hand radio.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Harry's smile fades gradually as Chili directs a smile toward her, and they both appear captivated by the moment. Martin finds himself leaning slightly before shifting his weight to lean forward even more. Bo Catlett shares an intense look with the Bear and makes a subtle gesture to the waiter, signaling him discreetly. Meanwhile, Karen, Martin, and Chili proceed to walk toward the driveway, and Chili attentively trails Martin over to the minivan, reaching out to open the door for him with a courteous gesture. All the while, Bo Catlett and Harry are sharing a hearty laugh, with Harry notably intoxicated as he polishes off yet another drink. Harry casts a bewildered gaze toward Bo, grappling with disbelief over the current state of his life, pausing momentarily to contemplate his circumstances before shaking his head in a mix of resignation and confusion. He surveys the restaurant, taking in the surroundings with a discerning look. Bo and the Bear engage in another wordless exchange as Chili and Karen make their entrance into the restaurant. Chili scans the bar area, noting their absence, before directing his gaze upward to the railing, keeping his focus there as he begins to speak. Another quick glance at the Bear follows, prompting everyone to shift their attention. Chili then advances toward the staircase, pinpointing the Bear in his conspicuous Hawaiian shirt situated a few steps from the top, and he gradually raises his gaze through a patch of vibrant hibiscus until he meets the bearded man's face. Chili ascends the stairs to approach Bo Catlett, who stands beside a table, unfastening his coat and halting three steps away while maintaining his stare fixed on the man's midsection. Bo proceeds to pass by Chili, descending the stairs as Karen observes. Bo Catlett, with a hand tucked away in his coat pocket, steps directly up to Chili; Karen watches him keenly. Even Karen regards him with a newfound perspective as they settle into the booth alongside a now startled and sobering Harry. Karen and Chili exchange meaningful glances as Harry finishes off his drink and perceives the two of them in a new light. Chili turns to Karen, offering a smile of acknowledgment while giving a slight shake of his head. Harry observes him for a moment before turning away to hang up the call on the other end of the phone. Contemplating the situation briefly, Bones dismissively tosses a book aside, holding the phone to his ear while Harry downs yet another drink, sitting upright as Bones bursts out of the bathroom. Bones swiftly grabs the phone, drawing Bones's attention as he fixates on it, pausing briefly to stare at the device. During this moment, Chili stands attentively as Curtis opens Chili's wallet, scrutinizing the driver's license while Dunbar, clad in a plaid shirt, retrieves a Lakers T-shirt from an athletic bag and feels around inside. Chili watches intently as Curtis picks up a note with the Newark Flight number and arrival time inscribed on it, cautiously scanning his surroundings to ensure solitude, before deftly extracting a key from a crack in the pavement near the stairwell—intended for the 'right' locker. Now, there's a burly figure in a plaid wool shirt standing nearby, the same individual present when Bo Catlett was around, accompanied by another man farther down the aisle engaged in a conversation over his hand radio.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Harry's smile fades as he and Chili exchange focused looks, while Martin leans forward. Bo Catlett signals the waiter after exchanging looks with the Bear. Outside, Karen, Martin, and Chili head to the driveway, with Chili opening the minivan door for Martin. Meanwhile, a drunken Harry and Bo share a laugh, with Harry pondering his life choices, shaking his head, and scanning the restaurant. As Chili and Karen enter, Chili surveys the bar, then the railing, maintaining his gaze upward while conversing. He notices the Bear on the staircase, and his attention moves up to the man’s face. Chili ascends the stairs toward Bo Catlett, unbuttons his coat, and pauses near him, focusing on his midsection. Bo passes Chili and descends the stairs, while Karen observes his approach, noting his hand in his pocket. As they settle into the booth with a now-alert Harry, Karen and Chili exchange significant looks. Harry finishes his drink, now seeing them differently. Chili smiles at Karen and shakes his head. Harry hangs up the phone after considering the situation. Bones, meanwhile, discards a book, continues with the phone, and draws Curtis’s attention as Bones emerges from the restroom. Curtis examines Chili's wallet and a note with flight details, discreetly retrieves a locker key from near the stairwell, while a big guy in plaid and another with a hand radio nearby complete the scene.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Harry's smile goes away as Chili, a charismatic loan shark with a knack for reading people, smiles at her, and they appear hooked. Martin, a film producer known for his intense focus on details, is leaning and then leans forward. Bo Catlett, a small-time criminal with big ambitions, exchanges a look with the Bear, a stoic enforcer known for his intimidating presence, and signals the waiter. Karen, Martin, and Chili walk out to the driveway, and Chili, who often displays surprising moments of chivalry, follows Martin over to the minivan, opening the door for him. In the meantime, Bo Catlett and Harry are laughing, with Harry very drunk after downing yet another glass of bourbon, a drink he often turns to during moments of stress, as he finishes another drink. Harry looks at Bo, unable to believe what's happening to his life as his career spirals out of control, thinks for a moment, shakes his head, and looks around the upscale restaurant, known for its exclusive clientele. Bo and the Bear exchange looks as Chili and Karen enter the restaurant. Chili checks out the bar, sees they aren't there, then looks up at the railing of the elegantly designed interior, keeping his eyes up there as he speaks. Another glance at the Bear, whose reputation precedes him, and they all look. Chili moves to the staircase, seeing the Bear in his brightly colored Hawaiian shirt, standing a few steps from the top, and slowly moves his gaze up through the vibrant hibiscus flowers in the shirt's print until he's looking at the man's bearded face. Chili continues up the stairs to where Bo Catlett stands beside the table, unbuttons his coat, and gets within three steps of the guy before stopping, keeping his eyes fixed on the man's gut, remembering the stories he's heard about Bo's dealings. Bo walks past Chili and goes down the stairs. Karen watches as Bo Catlett, with an air of calculated nonchalance, puts a hand in his coat pocket and steps right up to Chili; she looks at him. Even Karen, an actress used to reading people, is looking at him differently now as they slide into the booth with a now shocked, rapidly sobering Harry. Karen and Chili look at each other as Harry finishes his drink, and Harry looks at the two of them differently now, seeing a new alliance forming. Chili looks at Karen, smiles, and shakes his head, perhaps amused at the sudden change in their dynamic. Harry looks at him and then hangs up at the other end, ending a call that could shift his fortunes. Bones, known for his impulsive decisions, thinks about it a moment and tosses the book aside, while phone to his ear, Harry downs another drink and sits up as Bones bursts out of the john, grabbing the phone, getting Bones's attention. Bones stares at the phone, sits there a moment, also staring at the phone, caught in a moment of indecision, while Chili stands as Curtis opens Chili's wallet, looks at the driver's license, and Dunbar in the plaid shirt pulls the Lakers T-shirt out of the athletic bag, feeling the quality of the fabric. Chili watches Curtis pick up the note with the Newark Flight number and arrival time written on it, glances about to make sure no one's around, then pulls the key for the 'right' locker out from a crack in the pavement near the stairwell, a location often used for discreet transactions. Now there's a big guy in a plaid wool shirt next to him, the same guy seen when Bo Catlett was there, and another guy down the aisle talking on his hand radio, ensuring their operation runs smoothly.

Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. she looks at him. Even Karen is looking at him differently now as they slide into the booth with a now shocked rapidly sobering Harry. Karen and Chili look at each other as Harry finishes his drink and Harry looks at the two of them differently now. Chili looks at. Karen smiles and shakes his head. Harry looks at him and then hangs up at the other end. Bones thinks about it a moment and tosses the book aside while phone to his ear. Harry downs another drink and sits up as Bones bursts out of the john grabs the phone getting Bones's attention. Bones stares at the phone sits there a moment also staring at the phone. while Chili stands as Curtis opens. Chili's wallet looks at the driver's license and Dunbar in the plaid shirt pulls the Lakers Tshirt out of the athletic bag feels around inside. Chili watches. Curtis pick up the note with the Newark Flight number and arrival time written on it glances about to make sure no one's around then pulls the key for the 'right' locker out from a crack in the pavement near the stairwell. Now there is a big guy in a plaid wool shirt next to him. the same guy seen when Bo Catlett was there and another guy down the aisle talking on his hand. radio.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Flora's frown appears as Whiskers grins at him, and they seem captivated. Oliver is reclining and then slouches backward. Duke trades a glance with the Fox and gestures to the chef. Sarah, Oliver, and Whiskers stroll into the garden, and Whiskers trails Oliver over to the bicycle, closing the gate behind her. Meanwhile, Duke and Flora are chuckling, with Flora quite tipsy as she gulps another soda. Flora gazes at Duke, unable to fathom what's occurring with her career, ponders for an instant, nods, and glances around the gallery. Duke and the Fox swap glances as Whiskers and Sarah exit the gallery. Whiskers examines the cafe, notices they aren't present, then peers down at the chandelier, maintaining his gaze there as he whispers. Another peek at the Fox, and they all peer. Whiskers drifts to the elevator, spotting the Fox in his denim jacket lingering a few feet from the summit and gradually shifts his focus down through magnolias until she's staring at the woman's unshaven chin. Whiskers proceeds down the elevator to where Duke stands beside the chair, zips his jacket, and halts within ten feet of the gal before pausing, fixing his focus on the woman's shoes. Duke strolls in front of Whiskers and ascends the elevator. Sarah observes as Duke slips a finger into his jacket pocket and steps left next to Whiskers; he glances at her. Even Sarah is observing her strangely now as they glide into the corner seat with a now astonished, rapidly awakening Flora. Sarah and Whiskers glance at one another as Flora gulps her soda, and Flora stares at the pair differently now. Whiskers glances at Sarah, grins, and nods. Flora glances at her and then hangs down at the other edge. Pebbles reflects on it briefly and flings the parchment aside, while headset to her nose, Flora nurses another soda and leans back as Pebbles darts out of the living room, snatches the headset, grabbing Pebbles's intrigue. Pebbles glares at the headset, perches there briefly, also glaring at the headset, while Whiskers reclines as Marvin reveals Whiskers's handbag, inspects the library card, and Thatcher in the striped jacket tugs the Rockets hoodie from the gymnasium bag, digs around inside. Whiskers observes Marvin lift the list with the Boston Train number and departure time inscribed on it, scans around to ensure no one's nearby, then extracts the token for the 'left' safe out from a fissure in the sidewalk beneath the doorway. Now there's a tall lady in a striped cotton jacket beside her, the same person noticed when Duke was nearby, and another person down the lane chatting on his wristwatch.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Harry becomes despondent as Chili and Martin, appearing connected, walk to the minivan. Meanwhile, Bo Catlett and a drunk Harry laugh, with Harry contemplating his life at the restaurant. As Chili and Karen enter, Chili notices the Bear in a Hawaiian shirt on the stairs and approaches Bo Catlett. Karen and Chili join a shocked Harry in a booth, who is gradually sobering. Chili smiles at Karen, signaling a new understanding between them. Amidst Harry's drinking and phone call, Bones bursts in, drawing attention. Curtis examines Chili's wallet and notes a flight number and key hidden near the stairwell, observed by a man in plaid previously seen with Bo Catlett.
